Kunjungan Mendag AS, Peluang Tingkatkan Perdagangan dan Investasi
06 Nov 2019, 18:51 by Magdalena


Kunjungan Mendag AS, Peluang Tingkatkan Perdagangan dan Investasi

KBRN, Jakarta : Menteri Koordinator Bidang Perekonomian Airlangga Hartarto menerima kunjungan Menteri Perdagangan Amerika Serikat (AS) Wilbur Ross dan delegasinya di Kantor Kemenko Perekonomian, Jakarta Pusat, Rabu (6/11/2019).Pertemuan ini bertujuan untuk memperkuat kerja sama perdagangan dan investasi antar kedua negara. "Menteri Ross mengapresiasi hubungan Indonesia dan AS yang sudah terjalin selama 70 tahun ini. kata Airlangga, dan pertemuan ini membahas beberapa isu detil terkait invstasi, dan kerjasama AS di Indonesia," ujar Airlangga dalam keterangan bersama Wilbur Ross usai pertemuan.Selain itu, kata Menko Perekonomian, juga dibahas mengenai finalisasi review Generalized System of Preferences (GSP), dan Indonesia akan segera mengirimkan delegsinya dibawah tim kementerian perdagangan."AS juga mengundang Indonesia dalam event di AS terkait investasi, dan pada saat yang sama Menlu Indonesia menegaskan rencana Indonesia menyangkut kerjsama Indo-Pasific serta rencana pertemuan summit tahun depan," sambung Airlangga.Menurut Enggar, para pelaku usaha di Indonesia juga mendapat peluang kerjsama di berbagai sektor dengan pengusaha AS, antara lain di bidang kesehatan, jasa, dan sektor lainnya."Pada prinsipnya pemerintah akan memfasilitasi dan memberikan kemudahan. Karena sempat pula disinggung mengenai aturan batasan modal dan kemitraan," tukas Airlangga.Dalam 3 bulan ke depan, lanjutnya, masalah ini dijanjikan akan selesai, pemerintah sedang memperbaiki sejumlah aturan dan akan dimasukkan dalam omnibus law.Kunjungan Mendag AS ke Jakarta merupakan bagian dari rangkaian kunjungan ke kawasan Asia Tenggara, antara lain ke Thailand dan Vietnam. Dalam kunjungannya ke Kemenko Perekonomian, Secretary Ross didampingi oleh 24 orang pejabat pemerintahan AS dan Kedutaan Besar AS di Jakarta, serta 25 orang delegasi pebisnis AS yang bergerak pada berbagai sektor antara lain energi, teknik, konstruksi,  dan teknologi informasi.Dalam bidang ekonomi, AS berkepentingan menyelesaikan sejumlah hambatan perdagangan seperti persyaratan kandungan lokal minimum dan berbagai peraturan lain yang dianggap membatasi ruang gerak industri dan bisnis perusahaan AS di nusantara. AS pun menawarkan partisipasi dalam pembangunan infrastruktur, pekerjaan umum, energi dan sektor lainnya melalui kerja sama dengan pihak swasta dan BUMN.Mendag AS Wilbur Ross mengatakan pembicaraan hari ini sangat konstruktif, dan AS beserta sektor swastanya berkomitmen untuk meningkatkan kerjasama dengan Indonesia di masa depan."Saya dan semua anggota delegasi yakin dan bersemangat, dan saya kira investasi AS akan meningkat, begitupula hubungan dagang dengan Indonesia," ujar Ross.Ia juga mengundang, dan membuka kesempatan bagi pelaku usaha di Indonesia yang ingin menanamkan modalnya secara langsung di AS.AS merupakan negara tujuan ekspor nonmigas terbesar bagi Indonesia. Data Kementerian Perdagangan tahun 2018 menunjukkan, AS adalah mitra dagang terbesar ketiga bagi Indonesia dengan nilai perdagangan bilateral sebesar US$28,6 miliar, naik 10,42% dari periode sama tahun sebelumnya. Nilai Investasi Langsung (Foreign Direct Investment/FDI) AS di Indonesia juga menyentuh angka US$1,217 juta dengan 572 proyek. Sebaliknya, Indonesia adalah negara tujuan investasi dari para pengusaha AS dalam sektor ekstraktif atau sumber daya mineral, serta menjadi pasar potensial bagi produk-produk AS lainnya.“Maka itu, untuk memperluas perdagangan bilateral, kita harus fokus dalam kolaborasi membangun sebuah roadmap bernilai sekitar US$60 miliar untuk lima tahun ke depan dengan mengidentifikasi sektor-sektor tertentu, khususnya industri yang menyokong satu sama lain,” jelas Menko Airlangga.Turut hadir dalam pertemuan bilateral ini adalah Menteri Perdagangan Agus Suparmanto, Menteri Luar Negeri Retno Marsudi, Wakil Menteri BUMN Budi Gunadi Sadikin, Wakil Menteri Keuangan Suahasil Nazara, dan sejumlah pejabat lainnya.

US Trade Minister's Visit, Opportunity to Increase Trade and Investment
Nov 6 2019, 18:51 by Magdalena


US Trade Minister's Visit, Opportunity to Increase Trade and Investment

KBRN, Jakarta: Coordinating Minister for the Economy Airlangga Hartarto received a visit from the US Minister of Trade Wilbur Ross and his delegation at the Office of the Coordinating Ministry for the Economy, Central Jakarta, Wednesday (6/11/2019). This meeting aims to strengthen trade and investment cooperation between the two countries. "Minister Ross appreciated the relationship between Indonesia and the US that has existed for 70 years, said Airlangga, and this meeting discussed several detailed issues related to investment, and US cooperation in Indonesia," Airlangga said in a joint statement with Wilbur Ross after the meeting. The Coordinating Minister for the Economy also discussed the finalization of the Generalized System of Preferences (GSP) review, and Indonesia will immediately send a delegation under the trade ministry team. "The US also invited Indonesia to events in the US related to investment, and at the same time the Indonesian Foreign Minister reiterated Indonesia's plan regarding Indo-Pacific cooperation and next year's summit meeting plan, "continued Airlangga. According to Enggar, business people in Indonesia also had the opportunity to work together in various sectors with US entrepreneurs, including in the health, services and other sectors." In principle, the government will facilitate and provide convenience, because it was also mentioned about atu the limits of capital and partnerships, "said Airlangga. In the next 3 months, he continued, this problem was promised to be resolved, the government was improving a number of rules and would be included in the omnibus law. The US Trade Minister's visit to Jakarta was part of a series of visits to the Southeast Asia region. , including Thailand and Vietnam. During his visit to the Coordinating Ministry for the Economy, Secretary Ross was accompanied by 24 US government officials and the US Embassy in Jakarta, as well as 25 US business delegates engaged in various sectors including energy, engineering, construction, and information technology. In the economic field, the US interest in resolving a number of trade barriers such as minimum local content requirements and various other regulations that are considered to limit the space for industry and business of US companies in the archipelago. The US also offers participation in infrastructure development, public works, energy and other sectors through cooperation with the private sector and SOEs. US Trade Minister Wilbur Ross said the talks today were very constructive, and the US and its private sector are committed to increasing cooperation with Indonesia in the future. "I and all members of the delegation are confident and enthusiastic, and I think US investment will increase, as well as trade relations with Indonesia," said Ross. He also invited, and opened up opportunities for businesses in Indonesia who want to invest directly in the US. AS is the largest non-oil and gas export destination country for Indonesia. Data from the Ministry of Trade in 2018 shows, the US is the third largest trading partner for Indonesia with a bilateral trade value of US $ 28.6 billion, up 10.42% from the same period the previous year. The value of US Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) in Indonesia also touched US $ 1,217 million with 572 projects. In contrast, Indonesia is an investment destination country of US entrepreneurs in the extractive sector or mineral resources, as well as being a potential market for other US products. "Therefore, to expand bilateral trade, we must focus on collaborating to build a roadmap worth around US $ 60 billion for the next five years by identifying certain sectors, especially industries that support each other, "explained the Coordinating Minister for Airlangga. According to the bilateral meeting were Minister of Trade Agus Suparmanto, Foreign Minister Retno Marsudi, Deputy Minister of BUMN Budi Gunadi Sadikin, Deputy Minister of Finance Suahasil Nazara, and a number of other officials.
